intro: Verbesina tenoriesis, commonly known as the yellow crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and glandular. The flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
